name: 吴凯婷
awards: 2013年 第15届台北电影节 台北电影奖 最佳短片 (提名) 纸莲花
introduction: Born and raised in Taiwan, Kai-Ting is a writer-director who enjoys making films about family and culture. Kai-Ting studied Journalism and English in college, dreaming of becoming a world-renowned journalist. But somewhere between writing for the school paper and getting a job at the local news source, she stumbled her way into visual media and found her passion there. After graduation, Kai-Ting worked for award-winning programs designed for young adults at the Public Television Service in Taiwan.  Through this experience, she developed a great interest in stories that explore cross-cultural themes, and this inspired her to pursue further studies in the art of filmmaking. Kai-Ting recently graduated with an MFA degree in Film & TV Production at the University of Southern California.  Her thesis film, Paper Lotus, was awarded the Panavision New Filmmakers Grant and the UFVA Carole Fielding Grant. Kai-Ting is also a recipient of the Tania Trepanier Scholarship and the Bernard Kantor Award.
